title: Data page 1 is the data base menu page. It allows access to …
caption_en: Data page 1 is the data base menu page. It allows access to the JEPPESEN DATA BASE, PILOT DATA BASE and Data Transfer Unit (DTU) operation. I oo FR _

title: Data page 2 is the sensor summary page. The status of all se…
caption_en: Data page 2 is the sensor summary page. The status of all sensors is displayed here and access to sensors for control and more detailed information is through this page. J oo FR _

title: Data page 3 is the position summary page. position may be co…
caption_en: Data page 3 is the position summary page. position may be compared to any sensor listed by pressing the appropriate line select key. J oo FR _

title: Data page 4 is the general data page. Date and time entry ca…
caption_en: Data page 4 is the general data page. Date and time entry can be updated here after initialization. A manual heading entry can be made here in the event of a power failure. Roll command output and software versions of various components are also displayed. oo FR _

title: To interrogate the contents of the Jeppesen Data Base, press…
caption_en: To interrogate the contents of the Jeppesen Data Base, press the NAV DATA line select key. I oo FR _

title: The NAV Data Menu page allows access to waypoints by identif…
caption_en: The NAV Data Menu page allows access to waypoints by identifier, SIDs, STARs, APPROACHES, RUNWAYS and AIRWAYS. The currently installed data base region and expiration date are displayed. J oo FR _

title: For example, to interrogate NAV DATA about Singapore Changi …
caption_en: For example, to interrogate NAV DATA about Singapore Changi Airport Runways: Press 4L Select W and ENTER I oo FR _

title: For example, to interrogate NAV DATA about Singapore Changi …
caption_en: For example, to interrogate NAV DATA about Singapore Changi Airport Runways: Press 4L Select W and ENTER I oo FR _

title: The display shows the Runways available in Changi Internatio…
caption_en: The display shows the Runways available in Changi International Airport. Now select 1 into the cursor and ENTER. Detailed information of Runway is now shown. J oo FR _

title: The display shows the Runways available in Changi Internatio…
caption_en: The display shows the Runways available in Changi International Airport. Now select 1 into the cursor and ENTER. Detailed information of Runway is now shown. J oo FR _

title: Likewise, information on SID, STAR, APPROACH and AIRWAY of a…
caption_en: Likewise, information on SID, STAR, APPROACH and AIRWAY of a particular Airport can be called up in a similar manner. J oo FR _

title: Page 2 of DATANAV shows the active set of navigation data an…
caption_en: Page 2 of DATANAV shows the active set of navigation data and its expiry date. The inactive navigation data has the "ACTIVATE" prompt. This page allows the crew to activate the standby set in case the active set fails to drop off upon expiry. IR oo FR _

title: The system can store up to pilot created flight plan routes …
caption_en: The system can store up to pilot created flight plan routes comprised of up to 98 waypoints each, and up to pilot defined waypoints, arrivalsdepartures, approaches, runways, airports, alignment points and 25 radar waypoints. I oo FR _

title: Stored Pilot Routes can be called up and route copied on the…
caption_en: Stored Pilot Routes can be called up and route copied on the Flight Plan page. Selecting the copy RTE key displays a page consisting a list of stored Pilot Routes. Selecting the number of the desired route will paste that route onto Flight Plan page as the active route. IR oo FR _

title: They are meant for maintenance personnel. IR oo FR _
caption_en: They are meant for maintenance personnel. IR oo FR _

title: The HOLD POS, when selected, captures the instantaneous posi…
caption_en: The HOLD POS, when selected, captures the instantaneous position. Data in the HOLD POS page is the same as DATA page 3 of 4. I oo FR _

title: Pressing the FUEL key will access the first FUEL page for in…
caption_en: Pressing the FUEL key will access the first FUEL page for initialization of fuel data. This is the page which must be filled up during pre-flight. IE oo FR _

title: The empty weight displayed here is stored in the configurati…
caption_en: The empty weight displayed here is stored in the configuration module programmed at the time of installation. IR oo FR _

title: Entries made in the PAX field will be calculated at the weig…
caption_en: Entries made in the PAX field will be calculated at the weight displayed. In SIAs operation, the crew numbers are inserted in this field to obtain the PAX weight. This field is to input cargo weight. The is automatically calculated based upon the prior entries. may be directly entered, if desired. IE oo FR _

title: The GROSS WT is the sum of the and FUEL ONBOARD values. Gros…
caption_en: The GROSS WT is the sum of the and FUEL ONBOARD values. Gross weight will not be calculated until FUEL ONBOARD entry is made or confirmed. IR oo FR _

title: The ALTERNATE is the fuel required to the alternate landing …
caption_en: The ALTERNATE is the fuel required to the alternate landing field. HOLD is the fuel loaded for holding at the destination. EXTRA is the additional reserve fuel loaded beyond that for alternate landing field and holding. IR oo FR _

title: The Total Reserves value is automatically calculated based u…
caption_en: The Total Reserves value is automatically calculated based upon the three prior reserve fuel entries. If desired, this value may be directly entered. I oo FR _

title: Fuel on entry should be made as accurately as possible to pr…
caption_en: Fuel on entry should be made as accurately as possible to provide the best fuel predictions. Confirmation is required following initialization. Touch ENTER to accept 2700kg as the fuel onboard. TR oo FR _

title: Touch the MENU key. I oo FR _
caption_en: Touch the MENU key. I oo FR _

title: This page contains fuel units conversion calculator. By pres…
caption_en: This page contains fuel units conversion calculator. By pressing the line select keys on the left, conversion are made automatically. Touch type and ENTER. TR oo FR _

title: This page contains fuel units conversion calculator. By pres…
caption_en: This page contains fuel units conversion calculator. By pressing the line select keys on the left, conversion are made automatically. Touch type and ENTER. TR oo FR _

title: The FUEL ENTRY allows for fuel entries to be made for each t…
caption_en: The FUEL ENTRY allows for fuel entries to be made for each tank or total. Normally, fuelling is BY TOTAL. I oo FR _

title: The second page of FUEL is displayed by pressing the NEXT bu…
caption_en: The second page of FUEL is displayed by pressing the NEXT button. Actually flight plan information is imported to this display, however, manual input of ground speed and fuel flow estimates may be entered to compute fuel estimates, which may be useful before flight. I oo FR _

title: Once airborne, the information is replaced with real-time da…
caption_en: Once airborne, the information is replaced with real-time data. I oo FR _

title: FUEL page 3 consists of summary information. I oo FR _
caption_en: FUEL page 3 consists of summary information. I oo FR _

title: FUEL page 4 consists of summary of aircraft weight informati…
caption_en: FUEL page 4 consists of summary of aircraft weight information. I oo FR _

title: FUEL page 5 displays the fuel flow (kghr) inputs received fr…
caption_en: FUEL page 5 displays the fuel flow (kghr) inputs received from each engine, and the total fuel used. I oo FR _

title: Should an input fail or be inaccurate, manual fuel flow entr…
caption_en: Should an input fail or be inaccurate, manual fuel flow entries can be made here by pressing the appropriate line select key. IR oo FR _

title: When airborne, performance Page 11 will provide a synopsis o…
caption_en: When airborne, performance Page 11 will provide a synopsis of inflight information found on the fuel and flight plan pages. Manual entries may not be made on this page. TR oo FR _

title: The NAV page is accessed from any mode by pressing the NAV k…
caption_en: The NAV page is accessed from any mode by pressing the NAV key. IR oo FR _

title: Page 1 of NAV provides complete information about the curren…
caption_en: Page 1 of NAV provides complete information about the current and next navigation legs, and allows the pilot to alter the current navigation leg or select another lateral guidance mode. TR oo FR _

title: The first line consists of from waypoint identifier and the …
caption_en: The first line consists of from waypoint identifier and the time overhead the FR waypoint, or the takeoff time for the first flight. I oo FR _

title: This is the desired track (course) between the FR and the TO…
caption_en: This is the desired track (course) between the FR and the TO waypoint. J oo FR _

title: The distance in the box is the great circle distance express…
caption_en: The distance in the box is the great circle distance expressed in nautical miles, between the aircraft's present position and the TO waypoint. IR oo FR _

title: The estimated time enroute (ETE) is displayed in hours and m…
caption_en: The estimated time enroute (ETE) is displayed in hours and minutes between the aircraft's present position and the TO waypoint. J oo FR _

title: The TO line consists of TO waypoint identifier and the Estim…
caption_en: The TO line consists of TO waypoint identifier and the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA). Below is the great circle distance, course, and the ETE between the TO and the NX waypoints. IR oo FR _

title: This is the next waypoint on the flight plan after the curre…
caption_en: This is the next waypoint on the flight plan after the current leg and the ETA for that waypoints. IR oo FR _

title: Crosstrack is lateral distance in NM left or right of the ex…
caption_en: Crosstrack is lateral distance in NM left or right of the extended course centerline between the FR and TO waypoints, a maximum of maybe displayed. 1 oo FR _

title: Against the are three annunciations: - E for enroute - T for…
caption_en: Against the are three annunciations: - E for enroute - T for terminal - A for approach 1 oo FR _

title: (E) represents enroute scaling of i.e dots on the HSI latera…
caption_en: (E) represents enroute scaling of i.e dots on the HSI lateral deviation scale. 1 oo FR _

title: represents terminal scaling of i.e 1INM2 dots. 1 oo FR _
caption_en: represents terminal scaling of i.e 1INM2 dots. 1 oo FR _

title: (A) represents approach scaling of i.e dots. 1 oo FR _
caption_en: (A) represents approach scaling of i.e dots. 1 oo FR _

title: Other information on page 1 of NAV include - Wind - Ground s…
caption_en: Other information on page 1 of NAV include - Wind - Ground speed - Bearing and - Track angle error

title: The Quality Factor Q is a measurement of a systems probable …
caption_en: The Quality Factor Q is a measurement of a systems probable error in tenths of a nautical mile. Based on a 95 probability, a Q of 1 would represent a maximum position error of 1 oo FR _

title: When two sensors have nearly equal weighting in the NAV solu…
caption_en: When two sensors have nearly equal weighting in the NAV solution, they will be displayed as GPSDME. 1 oo FR _

title: Also available are line select keys for -UPDATE SENSORS - SE…
caption_en: Also available are line select keys for -UPDATE SENSORS - SENSORS, and -HOLD POSITION 1 oo FR _

title: Lets look at the various NAV maneuver options that are avail…
caption_en: Lets look at the various NAV maneuver options that are available. Touch the NAV function key. IR oo FR _

title: Touch the IR oo FR _
caption_en: Touch the IR oo FR _

title: The various options will now be discussed: - HOLDING DEFN -P…
caption_en: The various options will now be discussed: - HOLDING DEFN -PVOR -

title: This parallel track is selected from the NAV page. Touch the…
caption_en: This parallel track is selected from the NAV page. Touch the NAV function key. IR oo FR _

title: The crosstrack selection is selected by pressing the or key …
caption_en: The crosstrack selection is selected by pressing the or key as shown above. I oo FR _

title: When selected crosstrack is executed, the airplance will dev…
caption_en: When selected crosstrack is executed, the airplance will deviate from its current position and make a 45 intercept on the selected crosstrack. IR oo FR _

title: The above picture shows airplane is on the selected crosstra…
caption_en: The above picture shows airplane is on the selected crosstrack. The crosstrack which has moves one line upward; indicates 0, while the reminds the crew that selected crosstrack is in progress. I oo FR _

title: will be annunicated on the HSI to indicate that crosstrack s…
caption_en: will be annunicated on the HSI to indicate that crosstrack selection has been selected. IR oo FR _

title: Automatic leg change will occur abeam the next waypoint when…
caption_en: Automatic leg change will occur abeam the next waypoint when flying a Crosstrack. The aircraft resumes its normal track in the next leg. IR oo FR _

title: Selected crosstrack cancellation is done by the same method …
caption_en: Selected crosstrack cancellation is done by the same method by entering a zero as the offset. IR oo FR _

title: Cancellation of can also be effected on the MANEUVER page by…
caption_en: Cancellation of can also be effected on the MANEUVER page by pressing cancel selected crosstrack line select key. The appearance of is the result of selecting earlier on. I oo FR _

title: Selected Crosstrack is not available on Direct-To or Pseudo …
caption_en: Selected Crosstrack is not available on Direct-To or Pseudo VOR (PVOR) legs. IR oo FR _

title: Maneuver page. Touch the Holding defn IR oo FR _
caption_en: Maneuver page. Touch the Holding defn IR oo FR _

title: The "HOLD FIX" will always be filled in with the "TO" waypoi…
caption_en: The "HOLD FIX" will always be filled in with the "TO" waypoint. Assuming holding is to be done over number 6 must be selected into the prompt, and then ENTER. I oo FR _

title: The inbound (INBD) will be the current Desired track to that…
caption_en: The inbound (INBD) will be the current Desired track to that fix. - TURN will defauit to right hand hold - TIME will default to minute These parameters may be changed by the pilot. I oo FR _

title: The type of ENTRY - direct, parallel or teardrop - is determ…
caption_en: The type of ENTRY - direct, parallel or teardrop - is determined by the parameters just discussed. I oo FR _

title: When the parameters of the holding pattern are defined, line…
caption_en: When the parameters of the holding pattern are defined, line selecting ARM HOLD Key will allow the aircraft to fly the active flight plan and then automatically activate the holding pattern upon reaching which is the holding FIX. Touch ARM HOLD L SK to arm holding pattern. IE oo FR _

title: The ARM HOLD changes to Direct-to HOLD (DTO HOLD). This prom…
caption_en: The ARM HOLD changes to Direct-to HOLD (DTO HOLD). This prompt may be used if the intention is to proceed straight from present position to holding FIX, but let's disregard this. Touch RETURN IR oo FR _

title: This page has a HOLD ARMED below its title. This page also a…
caption_en: This page has a HOLD ARMED below its title. This page also allows the crew to disarm holding pattern prior to reaching holding FIX. Pushing DISARM HOLD L SK cancel all holding definitions. Let's disregard this. Touch RETURN IR oo FR _

title: An asterisk is seem against This reminds the crew that holdi…
caption_en: An asterisk is seem against This reminds the crew that holding is armed at It is also confirmed by the word "HOLD" enclosed in a bracket in the NX field. IR oo FR _

title: The "HOLD ARMED" feature is also shown on the flight plan pa…
caption_en: The "HOLD ARMED" feature is also shown on the flight plan page. IR oo FR _

title: Upon reaching the NAV display will show (HOLD) as the TO way…
caption_en: Upon reaching the NAV display will show (HOLD) as the TO waypoint and the NX field will be dashed. IR oo FR _

title: The estimated time of arrival (ETA) over the inbound fix is …
caption_en: The estimated time of arrival (ETA) over the inbound fix is shown on NAV and HOLDING pages. IR oo FR _

title: The PROCEED L SK is now available on the MANEUVER page. Pres…
caption_en: The PROCEED L SK is now available on the MANEUVER page. Pressing this function will cause the aircraft to continue the holding until crossing the FIX, then it will proceed on course as the flight plan directs. I oo FR _

title: If the intention is to exit the holding quickly, DTO key sho…
caption_en: If the intention is to exit the holding quickly, DTO key should be used. Touch DTO key. I oo FR _

title: Inserting the desired direct-to waypoint in this case) into …
caption_en: Inserting the desired direct-to waypoint in this case) into the cursor and ENTER will cause the aircraft to make the shortest turn and exit the holding pattern. Touch ENTER key to proceed to IR oo FR _

title: Inserting the desired direct-to waypoint in this case) into …
caption_en: Inserting the desired direct-to waypoint in this case) into the cursor and ENTER will cause the aircraft to make the shortest turn and exit the holding pattern. Touch ENTER key to proceed to IR oo FR _

title: To accomplish this maneuver without changing the flight guid…
caption_en: To accomplish this maneuver without changing the flight guidance controller to heading mode, we can simply press the on the NAV or MANEUVER page. I oo FR _

title: The overlay will be displayed and the cursor will be filled …
caption_en: The overlay will be displayed and the cursor will be filled with the present heading. IR oo FR _

title: Two heading mode options are available. If a clearance is re…
caption_en: Two heading mode options are available. If a clearance is received to turn left or right X" degrees, this may be commanded by pressing the or key while the cursor is over the data field. The field will change to read TURN L or TURN R, as selected, and entry of the turn in degrees may be made. IR oo FR _

title: If the clearance is to turn to a specific heading, enter the…
caption_en: If the clearance is to turn to a specific heading, enter the heading directly. Enter under and press ENTER twice. I oo FR _

title: Pressing ENTER second time will confirm the entry and the wi…
caption_en: Pressing ENTER second time will confirm the entry and the will steer the aircraft to the selected heading. If the autopilot is engaged, it will follow the command bars. SEL mode will be annunciated below the NAV page header and the TR oo FR _

title: The NAV page will display NO INTCPT in the overlay window, i…
caption_en: The NAV page will display NO INTCPT in the overlay window, indicating that this heading will not intercept the current NAV leg. I oo FR _

title: Using the same process as before, we simply type the new hea…
caption_en: Using the same process as before, we simply type the new heading command and the aircraft is directed to the new heading. Notice that the INTERCEPT prompt appears against If the INTERCEPT key is not selected, the will continue to fly mode indefinitely. TR oo FR _

title: If the clearance by the controller is to resume normal navig…
caption_en: If the clearance by the controller is to resume normal navigation, then the INTERCEPT key must be selected. Touch the INTERCEPT key. I oo FR _

title: When the INTERCEPT mode is selected, it will be annunciated …
caption_en: When the INTERCEPT mode is selected, it will be annunciated below the NAV page header, and the SEL prompt appears. The will cause the aircraft to fly the until intercepting the original flight plan route. I oo FR _

title: If cancel heading is selected, the will automatically set up…
caption_en: If cancel heading is selected, the will automatically set up to 45 intercept to the current NAV LEG. With crosstrack less than 12 the will make a smart turn onto the current NAV LEG. I oo FR _

title: The PVOR page provides the capability to track to or from an…
caption_en: The PVOR page provides the capability to track to or from any know waypoint on a programmed radial. I oo FR _

title: The PVOR page is accessed from: -DTO page and line selecting…
caption_en: The PVOR page is accessed from: -DTO page and line selecting PVOR - NAV page, MANEUVER option selected Touch the highlighted PVOR I oo FR _

title: The PVOR definition page will display the current TO waypoin…
caption_en: The PVOR definition page will display the current TO waypoint from the flight plan, and the subsequent waypoints will be displayed in a list. The desired PVOR point may be chosen from the list, manually entered at the cursor, or the LIST feature may be used. Let's insert waypoint 6 and ENTER I oo FR _

title: After the waypoint is identified, the cursor will move to th…
caption_en: After the waypoint is identified, the cursor will move to the DESIRED TRACK field. The desired track may be entered directly, or an inbound or outbound radial may be defined and the desired track will be calculated. Use the keypad and type and ENTER. Touch ACCEPT key. I oo FR _

title: Pressing Accept will change the current NAV leg to the PVOR …
caption_en: Pressing Accept will change the current NAV leg to the PVOR and a 45 intercept to the defined radial will be steered. The mode may be sued to fly the intercept if desired. TR oo FR _

title: On reaching PVOR function is terminated and the aircraft res…
caption_en: On reaching PVOR function is terminated and the aircraft resumes its course to the next waypoint. I oo FR _

title: The PVOR mode can be deleted by performing a DIRECT TO (DTO)…
caption_en: The PVOR mode can be deleted by performing a DIRECT TO (DTO), making a manual leg change, or selecting the approach mode. TR oo FR _

title: When a PVOR outbound is defined, the next leg will be undefi…
caption_en: When a PVOR outbound is defined, the next leg will be undefined. It will be up to the pilot to exit PVOR by a manual leg change, DTO or selecting approach arm when available. I oo FR _

title: Nine waypoints (present position and eight defined VNAV wayp…
caption_en: Nine waypoints (present position and eight defined VNAV waypoints) are available under the VNAV function. I oo FR _

title: Up to eight VNAV waypoints are automatically prefilled in re…
caption_en: Up to eight VNAV waypoints are automatically prefilled in reference to flight plan waypoints. I oo FR _

title: The VNAYV page will display the vertical speed required base…
caption_en: The VNAYV page will display the vertical speed required based on present groundspeed to obtain the target altitudes at the VNAYV waypoints. I oo FR _

title: Aircraft deviation from the vertical flight path is output t…
caption_en: Aircraft deviation from the vertical flight path is output to the flight guidance system VNAV deviation pointer. I oo FR _

title: Enroute VNAYV profile may be flown while couple to the fligh…
caption_en: Enroute VNAYV profile may be flown while couple to the flight guidance system. The computes a vertical pitch command which is recognised when VNAV is selected on the flight guidance controller. I oo FR _

title: VNAV mode will be exited and all vertical waypoints will be …
caption_en: VNAV mode will be exited and all vertical waypoints will be cancelled under any of the conditions listed above. I oo FR _

title: Should any target vertical speed value be rejected, a messag…
caption_en: Should any target vertical speed value be rejected, a message will be displayed top of the path VNAV page giving the reason. I oo FR _

title: Press the VNAV button to display VNAV definition display. TO…
caption_en: Press the VNAV button to display VNAV definition display. TO waypoint, and subsequent flight plan waypoint (maximum of 8) will follow. I oo FR _

title: Press the VNAV button to display VNAV definition display. TO…
caption_en: Press the VNAV button to display VNAV definition display. TO waypoint, and subsequent flight plan waypoint (maximum of 8) will follow. I oo FR _

title: Our descent plan is to cross at at and to cross before at ft…
caption_en: Our descent plan is to cross at at and to cross before at ft. IR oo FR _

title: The list page allows us to select 3 for from the list. Selec…
caption_en: The list page allows us to select 3 for from the list. Select 3 and ENTER. I oo FR _

title: The cursor remains over to allow an offset to be entered if …
caption_en: The cursor remains over to allow an offset to be entered if desired. Since the clearance is to cross at offset does not apply. Press ENTER. IE oo FR _

title: Type and ENTER. I oo FR _
caption_en: Type and ENTER. I oo FR _

title: Entry of and ENTER will designate the altitude entry as The …
caption_en: Entry of and ENTER will designate the altitude entry as The distance and vertical speed required will be displayed and the cursor will move to the VS field. I oo FR _

title: The computed Top Of Descent distance and the flight path ang…
caption_en: The computed Top Of Descent distance and the flight path angle (FPA) of will be displayed. The picture on the right is representation of the data on the display. I oo FR _

title: In a similar manner on the VNAV page, is designated with ft …
caption_en: In a similar manner on the VNAV page, is designated with ft altitude constraint. I oo FR _

title: As for since the clearance is ft 10 NM before an offset of N…
caption_en: As for since the clearance is ft 10 NM before an offset of NM is placed on the field after Entering these information will arm the for a step-down flight profile. IR oo FR _

title: If the clearance is to cross after at ft, then an offset of …
caption_en: If the clearance is to cross after at ft, then an offset of is inserted against I oo FR _

title: When the aircraft is 2 minutes from the Top of Descent captu…
caption_en: When the aircraft is 2 minutes from the Top of Descent capture point the light flashes and the message TOP OF DESCENT ALERT appears on the page. IR oo FR _

title: During the 2-minutes period the pilot may arm VNAV on the Pl…
caption_en: During the 2-minutes period the pilot may arm VNAV on the Please note that Altitude Preselect must be setto an altitude defined in the IR oo FR _

title: At seconds to TOD or any other vertical waypoints, will flas…
caption_en: At seconds to TOD or any other vertical waypoints, will flash again and "VERTICAL ALERT" appears on the message page. I oo FR _

title: The vertical deviation at capture is dependent upon aircraft…
caption_en: The vertical deviation at capture is dependent upon aircraft speed and the path angle. IE oo FR _

title: On the VNAYV page, a Vertical Direct To (VTO) feature allows…
caption_en: On the VNAYV page, a Vertical Direct To (VTO) feature allows the aircraft to by-pass any altitude constraints. I oo FR _

title: Selecting VTO key leads to VERTICAL TO list page which consi…
caption_en: Selecting VTO key leads to VERTICAL TO list page which consists of all the defined VNAV waypoints. Assuming that the clearance now is to cancel the altitude constraint at we will select 2, which is into the cursor. Type 2 and ENTER I oo FR _

title: The VIS will be the vertical speed required which was displa…
caption_en: The VIS will be the vertical speed required which was displayed when VTO was selected. However, when VIS is re-selected, will re-calculate TOD from the present position. This is shown on on the right. IR oo FR _

title: Pressing the line select key at any time will cause the mode…
caption_en: Pressing the line select key at any time will cause the mode to cancel and VNAYV display will go invalid. IR oo FR _

title: The entire VNAYV profile can be deleted by the following ste…
caption_en: The entire VNAYV profile can be deleted by the following steps: 1)Press any TO or NX 2)Enter the number The vertical flight profile is deleted and VNAV pages will be filled with the next 9 waypoints on the I oo FR _
